text: harness training your cat is the first
step to letting them safely explore
outside on a leash but training cats is
not commonly done so naturally many
people have questions about how to get
started I'm going to follow this
step-by-step article by Rachel Garner of
why animals do the thing to harness
trained trash bag the cat the link to
the article will be in the description
below so first we need our harness this
one is by soapy mousse and the lead will
come later
some purely irresistible treats whatever
the cat's favorite is this works better
if the cat can't get their streets in
any other circumstance loads and loads
of patience and of course the cat in
question this is trash bag he's a young
adult cat who's never been harnessed
trained before step one is learning the
harness is harmless this was very easy
for trash bag who did not care about its
existence in any way shape or form
I couldn't even annoy him with it but as
soon as the treats came out it was a
different story
step two is supposed to involve
rewarding the cat when they investigate
the harness this didn't happen trash bag
wouldn't leave me alone when I had
treats so I had to lure him with them
from the very start this is his first
session alluring him into the harness
he normally likes to retreat when eating
food anyway
so the pulling back is normal behavior
for him
we accidentally did step three just a
little too early but rewarded him with
lots of extra treats for no extra work
and then end it on a slightly easier
step we do this every day just for a few
minutes as we worked on step 3
no cheating
step3 is supposed to be getting his head
through the harness and staying there
but trash bag always pulls back so I
just let him then it's a matter of
letting him step through the harness
himself when he returns for more treats
which he will do as long as the leg hole
is big enough
step four is buckling the harness which
he will let me do so long as he has
stepped through the harness on his own
he doesn't like me touching his leg but
that's fine
once he stepped through I dropped the
extra trades and he will let me buckle
it on my own
then all that's left to do is to get him
comfortable in the harness and we're
still working on that just a little bit
every day so these steps are fairly
simple and easy to follow but things
don't always go quite according to plan
if trashbag ever seemed stressed then I
backed off he really only likes the
chicken flavored treats not the salmon
ones for some reason and sometimes he
just wasn't in the mood for training he
generally did best when he was good and
hungry these training sessions are also
best done one-on-one without other cats
causing a distraction here comes Walker
providing a distraction and stealing
treats another unintended consequence of
filming this video is the trash bag now
thinks the camera tripod and blanket
means it's Treat time even if there's
nothing going on
so grab your harness and start training
your cat let us know how you go in the
comments below my name is dr. Farex
this was trash bag and Wonka the cat and
we will see you next time
